author: jpata
body:
The current igprof MEM analysis copied the final output file specified with the -o option. As we learned, this should not be used, as it contains incorrect or misleading data (the MEM usage is much lower than what is expected).

Instead, we want to make sure we copy IgProf.N.gz files created by the customize function, and the IgProf.99.gz file (for N=100) should be used for the final MEM analysis.

AFAIK, using the igprof pp / CPU file specified by -o is still fine.

cc @slava77
title: copy igprof mem interim outputs
